Chessboard.pieces

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • Chessboard.pieces.Piece
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook, SuperPiece

    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Piece-class from which other pieces are extended. Fields: - Position, integer - Colour, boolean (true = white, false = black) - Sign, character (e.g. P = white pawn. See more info at Chessboard.java).

      • getPosition

        public int getPosition()
        Returns the position of this Piece.
        Returns:
        Integer, position of the piece.

      • setPosition

        public boolean setPosition(int position)
        Sets the position of this Piece. -1 means piece is outside the board.
        Parameters:
        position - Integer, position of this piece.
        Returns:
        True, if given position is valid, false otherwise.

      • getSign

        public char getSign()
        Returns the piece's sign as a character.
        Returns:
        Character, sign of this piece.

      • amIWhite

        public boolean amIWhite()
        Returns boolean value, telling the colour of the piece.
        Returns:
        True, if piece is white, false if piece is black.

      • setHasMoved

        public void setHasMoved(boolean value)
        Sets the hasMoved value to true meaning that the piece has moved in the game.

      • getHasMoved

        public boolean getHasMoved()
        Returns the boolean value, whether this piece has moved yet in the game.
        Returns:
        Boolean, true means piece has moved, false means it hasn't.

      • getPossibleMoves

        public abstract List<Move> getPossibleMoves(Chessboard chessboard)
        Returns an ArrayList of Move-objects, which are possible for the piece in question.
        Parameters:
        chessboard - Chessboard-object, which pieces are to be moved.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Move-objects.

      • isMoveValid

        public abstract boolean isMoveValid(Chessboard chessboard,
                                    int end)
        Verifies if this Piece can be moved to the end position according to the chess rules.
        Parameters:
        chessboard - Chessboard-object, which pieces are to be moved.
        end - Position, where the current Piece-object is to be moved.
        Returns:
        True, if command is valid, false otherwise.

      • createStraightMoves

        protected List<Move> createStraightMoves(Chessboard chessboard)
        Objects protected helper-method. Creates Move-objects horizontally and vertically from the Piece-objects position (i.e. like Rook).
        Parameters:
        chessboard - Chessboard-object, which pieces are to be moved.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Move-objects.

      • createDiagonalMoves

        protected List<Move> createDiagonalMoves(Chessboard chessboard)
        Objects protected helper-method. Creates Move-objects diagonally from the Piece-objects position (i.e. like Rook).
        Parameters:
        chessboard - Chessboard-object, which pieces are to be moved.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Move-objects.

      • checkStraightRoutes

        protected boolean checkStraightRoutes(Chessboard chessboard,
                                      int end)
        Verifies, if the horizontal or vertical route until the end square is free.
        Parameters:
        chessboard - Chessboard-object, which pieces are to be moved.
        end - Position, where the current Piece-object is to be moved.
        Returns:
        True, if route is free, false otherwise.

      • checkDiagonalRoutes

        protected boolean checkDiagonalRoutes(Chessboard chessboard,
                                      int end)
        Verifies, if the diagonal route until the end square is free.
        Parameters:
        chessboard - Chessboard-object, which pieces are to be moved.
        end - Position, where the current Piece-object is to be moved.
        Returns:
        True, if route is free, false otherwise.

      • isCommandValid

        protected boolean isCommandValid(int end)
        Does the basic validation of given move, i.e. is any of the coordinates outside of the board.
        Parameters:
        end - Position, where the current Piece-object is to be moved.
        Returns:
        True if coordinates are valid, false otherwise.

        Returns:
